message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about photosynthesis and the requirements for the process to occur. Photosynthesis requires sunlight as a source of energy, so a blackberry bush would have difficulty photosynthesizing at night when there is no sunlight available. Options (A), (C), and (D) are all incorrect because they all involve conditions where sunlight is present, which would actually support photosynthesis.

This question requires basic knowledge about photosynthesis and the requirements for this process to occur. Photosynthesis requires sunlight as a source of energy, so if a blackberry bush is unable to access sunlight, it would have difficulty in photosynthesizing. Option (A) is incorrect because the sun is necessary for photosynthesis. Option (C) is not specific enough and does not address the availability of sunlight. Option (D) is incorrect because daylight includes sunlight. Option (B) is the correct answer because photosynthesis cannot occur at night when there is no sunlight available.

Option (D) is incorrect because daylight is necessary for photosynthesis.
